messages.title: Positive vision for Beeston
messages.content: Greg Marshall outlines his work and vision for Beeston, focusing on development on the horizon and various successful initiatives such as reducing empty properties, a vibrant daytime and night-time economy, and cultural activities.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Greg Marshall pledges to meet our NHS needs and keep it well funded.
He promises to fight for jobs and the economy, supporting enterprises that will help everyone and not just the few.
Calls for investment in housing and better schools, aiming to better serve modern needs and standards.
He will work towards a Brexit that works for everyone and represent all views in the process.

issues.brexitEurope: He will work towards a Brexit that works for everyone and represent all views in the process.
issues.economy: He promises to fight for jobs and the economy, ensuring priority will be given to support enterprises that will help everyone and not just the few.
issues.education: Calls for investment in housing and better schools, aiming to serve modern needs and standards, with improved technology for current and future generations.
issues.health: Greg Marshall pledges to meet our NHS needs and keep it well funded. He emphasizes expanding care for the elderly, sick, and vulnerable, and wants increased investment to prevent privatisation.

housing.content: Calls for investment in housing to better serve modern needs and standards.

leaflet.personalStatement: Greg Marshall emphasizes his local connection to Broxtowe and his commitment to represent his constituents.

politicalExperience.achievements: Implementing a policy to bring vacant shop units back into use and transforming the Beeston Town Centre.

images.caption: Greg Marshall pictured within the community.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet also contains a section requesting constituent involvement and feedback.
